creator: hrbek@iinfo.cz
text:
There is problem in apache 1.3.26 with POST request processing. Sometimes I get
this type of request (entry from access_log):

delta_ts=20020617115013&longdesclength=4POST /process_bug.cgi HTTP/1.1

next entry is:

delta_ts=20020617115013&longdesclength=4GET /show_bug.cgi?id=3410
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
This request has probably broken CONTENT-TYPE parameter.


This bug happens only with apache 1.3.26 - in poor Perl CGI and in PHP 3.0.18/4.2.1.

creator: gphillip@aafp.org
text:
I believe I may be getting the same bug.  I have apache 1.3.26 on both Solaris 8
and Redhat 7.3.  I have been getting these types of errors:

 Invalid method in request Issue=March+2002&Link=20020300&credits=3GET
/redesignimages/spacer.gif HTTP/1.1

creator: emmguyot@free.fr
text:
I encounter the bug with Apache 1.3.26 on Windows 2000.
The POST works most of the time, but I identified a case it doesn't : Through a 
Proxy which uses HTTP/1.0

I hope this bug will be fix soon

creator: emmguyot@free.fr
text: I downgrade to 1.3.24 and I still have the problem.

Created attachment 2965
Packet capture of 2 POST : One doesn't work, One does
creator: emmguyot@free.fr

text:
About the attachment : 
Packets 62, 63, 65 & 66 are the POST which doesn't work
Packets 141 & 142 are the POST which works

When you compare this packets, you see that the packet including the end of 
header contains the data too when it works whereas the data are in a separate 
packet when it doesn't.

I don't if both are correct according to HTTP standard. Anyone knows ?
If it isn't, it wouldn't be a bug Apache.

Please note that I've changed the assignement of the bug to speed up the 
resolution.

N.B. : I've captured using a direct connection (no proxy) with Analyzer 2.2 for 
Windows (analyzer.polito.it).
creator: emmguyot@free.fr

text:
I've identified that the problem I met is a mod_gzip one.

mod_gzip 1.3.19.1a has a known, but not yet corrected, bug with big POST.
